intro: Chironia centaurium var. pulchella, commonly known as the purple centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branching. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
